definition: to rule according to the law
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research

sentences.english: He said that rule by law is a fundamental strategy of China.
sentences.chinese: 他说，依法治国是中国的基本方略。

sentences.english: He, in ruling the country by law, specially stresses the law with content and the criminal law from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 在依法治国中，他特别强调要法而有实，刑自贵始。

sentences.english: Administering our country by law is the basic polcy under the leadership of the party.
sentences.chinese: 依法治国是党领导人民治理国家的基本方略。

sentences.english: The essence of public security is to execute laws impartially, which is also the basic requirement of running the state according to law.
sentences.chinese: 公正执法是公安工作的灵魂，是依法治国的基本要求。

sentences.english: Ruling the country by law is the basic principle the Party pursues while it leads the people in running the country.
sentences.chinese: 依法治国，是党领导人民治理国家的基本方略。

sentences.english: Ruling the country by law act is to bring the part into the rule -by-law system.
sentences.chinese: 而依法治国就是要把党的领导纳入到法治的轨道。

sentences.english: The rule of law constitutes the essential requirement of socialist democracy.
sentences.chinese: 依法治国是社会主义民主政治的基本要求。

definition: rule of law/to rule by law
rule by virtue/rule by setting virtuous example (Confucian ideal)
Scientific Outlook on Development, a guiding principle for the CCP attributed to Hu Jintao 胡錦濤|胡锦涛[Hu2 Jin3 tao1], incorporated into the Constitution of the CCP in 2007
to fight corruption and advocate probity

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 te4 se4 she4 hui4 zhu3 yi4

definition: Four Comprehensives (political guidelines announced by President Xi Jinping, 2015)
to manage state affairs/to govern the country

pinyin: ren2 min2 min2 zhu3 zhuan1 zheng4

definition: the mass line, CCP term for Party policy aimed at broadening and cultivating contacts with the masses
